meanings.definition: A person who ducks or dodges.
meanings.sent1: The doucker swiftly avoided the ball thrown at him.
meanings.sent2: The skilled doucker dodged the punches effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The doucker at the game was impossible to hit, like a ninja in disguise.
meanings.sent4: She was a doucker in arguments, always finding a way to avoid confrontation.
meanings.sent5: The doucker's reflexes were as quick as lightning, making them unbeatable in dodgeball.

meanings.definition: To lower the head or body quickly to avoid a blow or missile.
meanings.sent1: He had to doucker to avoid getting hit by the flying object.
meanings.sent2: The player had to doucker to evade the opponent's attack.
meanings.sent3: The cat had to doucker to escape the playful swipe of its owner.
meanings.sent4: She had to doucker under the tree branch to avoid hitting her head.
meanings.sent5: The soldier had to doucker to dodge the enemy's bullets during the battle.

meanings.definition: A diving bird of the genus Aythya.
meanings.sent1: The doucker gracefully dived into the water to catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: The doucker bird swiftly disappeared beneath the surface of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The doucker bird's dives were so elegant, they looked like a synchronized swimmer.
meanings.sent4: The doucker bird's movements were as smooth as a dancer's on stage.
meanings.sent5: The doucker bird's underwater agility was a sight to behold, like a ballet in nature.
